thread.title: Brexit deal AGREED on a 'technical level' says Government source

author: Daniel Milligan
title: Brexit deal AGREED on a 'technical level' says Government source
text:
Brexit deal AGREED on a 'technical level' says Government source A deal for Brexit has been agreed on a “technical level” - Government source says Share Britain's Secretary of State for Exiting the European Union Dominic Raab, left, and EU chief Brexit negotiator Michel Barnier (Image: AP) Get daily updates directly to your inbox Subscribe Thank you for subscribing We have more newsletters Show me See our privacy notice Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email
A Brexit deal has been agreed on a “technical level”, a Government source says.
Negotiators in Brussels will now be the focus of a crunch Cabinet meeting on Wednesday, while it is understood cabinet ministers will be called one-by-one to Downing Street on Tuesday evening to run through the Brexit agreement.
The Prime Minister's spokesman says Theresa May told Cabinet ministers there are a "small number of outstanding issues" during the Brexit talks "as the UK pushes for the best text that can be negotiated".
There has been no official confirmation from either Downing Street or Brussels. Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
Irish broadcaster RTE reported that a "stable" text had been agreed on the thorny issue of the Northern Irish border.
The broadcaster said the deal involved one overall backstop in the form of a UK-wide customs arrangement, but with deeper provisions for Northern Ireland on customs and regulations. Read More
